headline.main: Afghan Victors Agree to Talks On Interim Rule

lead_paragraph: Bowing to American pressure, Northern Alliance officials agreed today to attend a meeting of Afghan opposition groups somewhere outside the country, eliminating one of the initial stumbling blocks to the creation of an interim government here. Secretary of State Colin L. Powell and other American officials applauded the move as diplomatic efforts began finally to catch up to the lightning military developments that have left Taliban forces in control of only two isolated pockets of the country.
abstract: Afghanistan's Northern Alliance, bowing to American pressure, will attend meeting of Afghan opposition groups, eliminating one of initial stumbling blocks to creation of interim government; Sec of State Colin L Powell and other US officials praise move as lightning military developments leave Taliban forces in control of only two isolated pockets of country; meeting will involve dozen Afghan factions and half dozen countries; Pakistan-based opposition groups now view Kabul as Alliance territory, while Alliance adamantly refuses to attend meeting in Pakistan, its longtime rival; Dr Abdullah Abdullah, Alliance's foreign minister, says some of venues proposed by UN are acceptable, including Germany, Austria or Switzerland (M)
snippet: Bowing to American pressure, Northern Alliance officials agreed today to attend a meeting of Afghan opposition groups somewhere outside the country, eliminating one of the initial stumbling blocks to the creation of an interim government here.    ...
